description: a(1) = 2, a(n) = smallest number greater than n which is not coprime to n.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(2m) = 2m+2, a(p)= 2p if p is a prime.a(n)= n + the smallest divisor (more than 1) of n.a(p^k) = p^k + p if p is prime. - _Robert Israel_, Oct 21 2015
example: a(9) = 12 as 10 and 11 are coprime to 9. a(11) = 22 as 11 is a prime.
maple: for n from 1 to 150 do if n=1 then printf(`%d,`,2); fi: for k from n+1 to 2*n do if igcd(n,k)>1 then printf(`%d,`,k); break; fi: od: od:# alternative:2, seq(t + min(numtheory:-factorset(t)), t = 2..1000); # _Robert Israel_, Oct 21 2015
prog: (Haskell)a061228 n = n + a020639 n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 06 2015
author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 23 2001
extensions: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Apr 24 2001
